intro: Talauma mutabilis var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved talauma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the rainy season. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with opposite leaf arrangement and small, fleshy fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
